hosts.blurb:
Jesse Simons is a hoarder of all knowledge with a concentration in the useless.  He honed his craft for over a decade in Ithaca, NY, using his meager trivia winnings to help put himself through graduate school.  His passions lean nerdy: puzzle hunts, crosswords, coding, literature, and, of course, trivia, but Jesse likes to hide the true depth of his pure geekdom through powerlifting and ultimate.  His pop-culture tastes tend towards hipster snobbery and highfalutin artiness, but he's never above dancing to Jackson 5 or Justin Timberlake or Beyoncé or, frankly, anything.

Among his superpowers is the ability to communicate with animals, to always locate the spoon drawer, to eat faster than a speeding bullet, etc. His counterbalancing superweaknesses include the inability to look left, inscrutable penmanship, perilously flat feet, and an allergy to ignorance.

My love of music started as a young teen growing up in NYC where we used to have "crews" that would go and spin music at various house parties.

While attending high school at Phillips Andover Academy, I continued my love of music by studying classical guitar, music theory and music history. While there were no declared majors at PA, I was acknowledged during commencement as graduating with honors in music and also reveived the Mark Larner Fellowship in The Arts. I continued to study classical guitar performance and music history during my first year at Oberlin College. Also while at Oberlin, a group of friends and I used to DJ at various parties around campus.

While I do not study or perform any more, I have a great love for classical and other musical styles that is demonstrated during intimate cocktail functions.

My professional DJ experience started by doing computerized light shows at Hurricane O'Reillys, a Downtown Boston nightclub. While there, DJ Dan of DM Productions started to teach me how to use professional DJ equipment, how to put sets of music together and how to eventually open the night until his arrival. I continued to work with him there and at other functions until working a recurring gig at the former T's Pub, a once well-known sports bar in Brighton.

While at T's Pub, I was also hired by DJ Michael of MCO Productions. By working with him, I further learned the elements of beat mixing, music selection and reading the crowd to keep them entertained. To date, I have worked over 100 weddings and various other functions with MCO Productions and still continue to work for the company today.

People often ask me how I got into this line of work. What I tell them is that ever since I was a
young boy I have loved music, all kinds of music. I used to listen to my parents albums all the
time. Eventually they started to buy me my own records. When I was in high school I heard that
the senior class was trying to plan a Valentine’s dance. By this time I had a good collection of
albums and 45 rpm’s so I volunteered to help with the music and I also happened to know a bit
about hooking up stereo equipment. After that fateful night I was hooked. I soon convinced my
parents to allow me to buy some DJ equipment of my own and off I went. I started to do all of
the school dances. The money that they paid me went towards buying new music. After high
school I started to do private parties and weddings and I haven’t stopped.

While attending college I spent a summer at the Connecticut School of Broadcasting where I
learned how to be a radio DJ. I received my FCC license and started to work at some small radio
stations in the area. Being on the radio was great but it wasn’t that same as being face to face
with people. There is something special about seeing a group of people getting together on the
dance floor and having fun.

It’s been over twenty-five years since that fateful day and I have been a part of hundreds of
functions of all different types and sizes. I have traveled all over New England, from the shores
of York, Maine and Cape Cod to the busy cities of Boston and Providence, RI. I have been at
elegant weddings and relaxed backyard parties and everything in between. I have met thousands
of people throughout the years and I have a million memories.

When I am not working I like to spend time with my family. I have been happily married for
nearly 20 years and we have two great kids. Our son Spencer is 18 yrs old and our daughter
Molly is 16 yrs old. Both love music like their father. I have played guitar for over 25 years and
over the last few years Spencer has started to play bass. It’s always fun when we get to crank up
the amps and play together. I am thankful that he likes a lot of the same artists that I do. I am a
big fan of Van Halen, and guitar oriented rock music. I also have a soft spot for 80’s music.

The McIntyre’s are also sports fans. My favorite sport is hockey so you can imagine how happy
I was when the Bruins won the Stanley Cup this past season. My all-time favorite player is Ray
Bourque. I have had the opportunity to meet him a few times and he is a class guy. We also
love watching the Red Sox and Patriots – Mrs. McIntyre is the only Celtics fan in the house.

Thank you for taking a few minutes to read this bio.

- – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – -

References

Reviews about working with MCO Productions and Pat:

Hi Patrick – Thanks you so much for doing an exceptional job at our wedding!! You were extremely professional and also had a great sense of how to gauge the room. Particularly good were your introductions, song selection, and your tact in setting up, dressing, and overall approach to it all. I’m not sure that our ‘best dancer’, Bill Bonificio, had a better night in his life because of your shout out. We enjoyed it all!Thank you again for doing an amazing job!!
Roger and Erin
(Biltmore Hotel, Providence)

 - – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – -

July 18, 2015 – Rennee and Chris Lammi
Thank you. We had a blast and our honeymoon was fantastic. Rennee and I are very happy and thought Patrick did a great job. He arrived early, nailed every request we had for the ceremony and reception, and helped us stay on task (we were running about 30 minutes behind due to cascading delays starting with the ceremony). All of our friends and family keep telling us how much fun they had; everyone was on the dancefloor all night.
Thanks for helping make our big day unforgettable.
(Nantasket  Beach Resort)

- – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – -

September 29, 2012 – Lauren & Matt Hollingstead
Pat did an outstanding job.  We received many compliments about the music and his DJ ability.  He was awesome! Lauren

 

(Private residence, Foxboro)

- – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – -

September 1, 2012 – Dana & Matthew Campion

Pat was our dream DJ. He was incredibly professional, friendly, and patient with us through our high maintenance, micro-managing of the music. We’ll definitely recommend him to friends who are looking for a wedding DJ. Best, Dana

 

(Exchange Conference Center, Boston)

- – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – -

July 14, 2012
Patrick was amazing. We had such a great time. He was so easy to work with and so many of my guests commented on how great the music was.
Thanks! Louisa
(Smith Barn, Peabody)

- – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – - – -

June 30, 2012

We had an amazing wedding day. Pat was absolutely fantastic, we couldn’t have asked for a better DJ. We were
short on time and only gave him some very basic guidelines, and he
knew exactly what to do. He was incredibly easy to work with,
thoughtful and very professional every step of the way. He listened to
our requests and helped to realize our vision of throwing a
sophisticated party where the crowd could still live it up on the
dance floor. He had everyone going (young and old) until last call.
And many of our guests stayed not only to the end, but hung around the
restaurant bar until closing time. It was exactly what we hoped for.
We can’t recommend Pat more highly. He was incredible.  Viviany
(Harvest, Cambridge)

College: Bridgewater State College
Occupation: Physical Education Teacher
Music: Classic Rock
Trivia Category: Sports, Movies, Music
Mike is married with two kids and  has been with MCO Productions since 2003.

occupation – teacher/trivia guy

home – Born and raised on Long Island, I now reside in Northborough.

musical tastes – The folks at the Tavern could tell you as well as I can, but I’ve played everything from Sinatra and early rock and roll to rap and current stuff, but most of what i play could fit neatly on the playlist of most classic rock radio stations. My preferences are the Beatles, Stones, Who, Dylan and Jimi for the classic stuff. As for artists of a more recent vintage, I’d include Weezer, Matthew Sweet, Fountains of Wayne, the White Stripes, the Strokes and the Black Keys.

trivia history – I hosted a gig for a short time at a the Black Sheep in Sterling, and I’ve filled in at several places in central Massachusetts. I’ve been the host at the Tavern on the Common in Rutland since it opened in October of 2008.

favorite movies – This Is Spinal Tap, Goodfellas, Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory and The Princess Bride

I’d love to hear comments/suggestions from trivia fans. E-mail me at mikeb@mcoproductions.com

John considers himself a native of Leominster, MA, although he moved there when he was three. His first memory is driving his Big Wheel down the ramp of the moving truck and pulling a sweet 180 on the sandy pavement, wowing the movers and frightening his mother. He attended the University of Massachusetts at Amherst, majoring in Communications and doing a little DJ‘ing at one of the school radio stations (WZZZ to be exact). He is married with two children and works as a writer in high technology. John has been hosting trivia since 2009. His favorite part of doing trivia is putting together the music with the questions to make sure the game is first and foremost a “fun night out” for the participants

Hometown- Island Park, NY
College- Nassau Community College
Occupation- Asst. Manager @ Kettle Brook Golf Course
Marriage Status- Married to Dawn 3 years
Favorite music genre- right now country
Favorite Movies- Caddyshack, Animal House, Slapshot
Favorite TV show- Family Guy
Favorite Trivia Category- SCIENCE or Sports
Hobbies- Hockey, Golf
Favorite Sports Teams- New York Yankees, New York Rangers, Buffalo Bills

I broke into professional DJing in 2002 while hosting Trivia nights, but quickly began other events such as
weddings, corporate events, ski promotions, and private parties.

Learning to play the drums at an early age has always kept me in touch with music and plays an
important role in being able to choose music that flows well through a night of getting people dancing.
While I’m fond of almost all genres of music (Funk, Soul, Hip-Hop, Jazz, etc.), I tend to be more aligned
with Indy, and alt-rock.

By day I do Photo Research for an educational publishing company. In my down time I enjoy
snowboarding, surfing, reading, and catching live music. I still play drums in local bands.
Chris hails from Brockton, MA. He is a proud father of CJ and Jazmyn, and a graduate of Bridgewater State. He especially enjoys country music.

Brendan is from Worcester, MA. He has been hosting for MCO since February of 2014. During the day, he teaches English at Chelsea High School, dreaming of the day that he finally nails his Jeopardy audition and can retire on a boat load of cash.

Brendan attended Fairfield University, where he studied English and Film. He has been involved in Improv Comedy since he was 14, most recently taking classes at the Improv Asylum in the North End. You should go there! It’s awesome!

Trivia about Brendan: He once appeared (briefly) on an episode of Saturday Night Live when he was interning there in college. He has auditioned for Jeopardy twice (still waiting for a call…). He has been to Ireland and Australia, as well as across the country in a Nissan Acura with two of his best pals.

Brendan hosts trivia at UNO’s in Harvard Square on Monday nights, and at Clarke’s in Faneuil Hall on Tuesday nights!

Michael grew up in Framingham, graduated from UMass Amherst.  Michael has been DJ’ing since 1990, starting MCO Productions in 1996.

Favorite music: Jazz, rock, rap, indie.

Michael’s DJ website:  djmichael.co

Phil Kliger is the most trivial person he knows. Hailing from Newton, Massachusetts, married to his one true love, and mostly a stay at home dad, “that trivia guy” Phil has been hosting MCO Trivia in Massachusetts and New Hampshire since the summer of 2004.  A rock and roll fan and host of The Uncle Phil Music Show-Intelligent Music for the Whole Family (2011′s Best of NH Magazine Editor’s Pick Award for Best Family Programming) Friday’s 10am-noon on http://www.wscafm.org , Phil enjoys watching movies, playing with his daughter, teaching Music Together, traveling through space, singing, existing on the astral plains and spreading the joy.  A songwriter by nature and a musical composer for film and video by design, Phil would like to one day meet each and every one of you, write and record your personal theme music for a modest fee, and sit down for milk and cookies.  If Phil was on your trivia team, he would excel at Music and Movies, but he’s not so much a Sports guy.

venues.name: The Wrentham Tavern
venues.blurb: We have a full selection of food for the whole family! Soups, Salads, Pizza, Seafood, Pasta, Burgers, a Kids Menu and much more!

venues.name: The Junction
venues.blurb: The Junction is your neighborhood bar, located in South Boston at the intersection of Dorchester Street and East and West Broadway. A Southie institution since 2002, the Junction features Trivia Tuesdays, live music four nights a week, and all the best sports games played on numerous TVs.

venues.name: Flatpenny Bar & Grille
venues.blurb:
Welcome to the Flat Penny Bar and Grill, your neighborhood spot for great food and a relaxing time out with family and friends.

We pride ourselves on our expansive lunch and dinner menus, our well-stocked bar, and an outstanding selection of draft and bottled beers.

The Flat Penny has a comfortable dining area, and a friendly bar.  We have 4 large screen TVs, so you can catch the B's, C's, Sox, and Pats in action.  We also have free WIFI so you can stay connected during a 'working' visit.

Stop by for a good meal, drinks with your friends, or just to lay your own penny on the railroad tracks

venues.name: Clarke's
venues.blurb: Since 1974, Clarke’s has been a cornerstone in Boston's historic Faneuil Hall neighborhood. Whether you're looking for a great place to have a bite to eat, grab a drink, catch a game, or plan an after-work party, Clarke’s is your spot!

venues.name: Profile Coffee Bar
venues.blurb: Profile Coffee Bar is passionate about serving traditional, artisanal, high quality coffee. Using ristretto as a base to all of our espresso, we aim to use only the purest forms of coffee extraction. Following those same principles, we also offer chemex pour overs, as well as cold brew, served fresh from the tap. Milk art? Our baristas are well versed. Everyone at Profile is a coffee aficionado. We love our coffee and hope you will too.

venues.name: The Warren Tavern
venues.blurb: The Warren Tavern is one of the most historic taverns in America. It is the oldest tavern in Massachusetts and was visited by many famous individuals including George Washington and Paul Revere.

venues.name: The Blue Mermaid
venues.blurb: The BLUE MERMAID ISLAND GRILL has served unique and delicious cuisine inspired by the flavors of the Caribbean to Portsmouth NH locals and visitors since 1994. Our menu features favorites like Jamaican Jerk Chicken, Guava-braised Short Ribs, New World Paella and Island Shrimp Pad Thai, along with many options for soup, salad, sandwiches and burgers, small plates and grilled seafood. Besides our great eats, we have eight rotating beers on tap from our favorite craft brewers, a wide selection of wines and a very tasty assortment of cocktails. We’re also known for our creative tropical coolers & Portsmouth’s best margaritas!

venues.name: Donohue’s Bar and Grill
venues.blurb: Come down for Trivia Night Sundays and 7P Washdays at 8P – Bring your team down to win your share of $125 – No Cover Charge - It’s a great time to flex your brain and win some cash at the same time.

text_blocks.title: Front Page Trivia
text_blocks.Content:
Looking for a great way to spice up your next corporate event, or want to establish a weekly trivia game at your bar or restaurant?

We are the leading provider of pub and event based trivia games in New England. We have an established set of talented hosts who are also available for private events and fundraisers.

text_blocks.title: Front Page DJ Services
text_blocks.Content:
We have a staff of experienced professional disc jockeys and masters of ceremony.

If you are interested in booking a disc jockey for a wedding or other upcoming event, you can find testimonials, staff profiles, and contact us to check availability and rates.

text_blocks.title: Book Section Header
text_blocks.Content: Check out our new book - The Best Bar Trivia Book Ever:  All You Need for Pub Quiz Domination
